data.title: Silly Prime Dev
data.solution:
from math import sqrt


def isPrime(n):
    if n < 2: return False
    for k in range(2, round(sqrt(n))+1):
        if n % k == 0: return False
    return True


limit = int(input())

print("private bool IsPrime(int number){")
for i in range(1, limit+1):
    output = "    "
    if i != 1: output += "else "

    isPrimeStr = ["false", "true"][isPrime(i)]
    output += f"if (number == {i}) return {isPrimeStr};"

    print(output)
print("}")
data.statement: You are the silliest goofy-ah dev of them all. You must write a program that will output a <<very well>> written <<Java>> function that will test if a number is prime, from <<1>> to the input [[N]].

(indents before the if statements are 4 spaces long)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are the silliest goofy-ah dev of them all. You must write a program that will output a very well written Java function that will test if a number is prime, from 1 to the input N.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of if statements.
Output
The function that will test if a number is prime up to N.
(indents before the if statements are 4 spaces long)
Constraints
1 <= N <= 1000
Example
Input
5
Output
private bool IsPrime(int number){
    if (number == 1) return false;
    else if (number == 2) return true;
    else if (number == 3) return true;
    else if (number == 4) return false;
    else if (number == 5) return true;
}
